UNIT 01 [ Beginner ] LESSON 01
Chapter 01 : Design Domain. Case Scenario.
Designing and Managing a Tech-Driven Co ee Shop
Introduction
Imagine stepping into a co ee shop where technology enhances every aspect of the experience - from a custom-designed co ee machine built by you to digital ordering systems and e cient business management strategies. In this project, you will act as an entrepreneur tasked with designing and managing a co ee shop. The government has provided space for a new co ee shop, but with a twist: instead of purchasing an existing co ee machine, you’ll design and build one yourself. Why? Because designing your own machine allows you to create a device that perfectly suits your shop’s unique needs, incorporates innovative features, and reduces dependency on pre-made, often expensive, machines. This project will integrate business strategy with design, electronics, robotics, and programming to build a functional co ee shop model from the ground up.
Mission
Your mission is to create a pro table, tech-driven co ee shop. You'll integrate business planning with modern technology to ensure operational e ciency, excellent customer service, and overall pro tability.
Scenario Context
Who: Entrepreneurs responsible for managing their own co ee shop. What: Develop a business plan and incorporate innovative technology into the shop’s operations. Where: The space provided by the government, with potential expansion to online platforms. When: Simulate the process of launching a co ee shop in a competitive market. Why: To understand how to establish a pro table and operationally e cient co ee shop, utilizing innovative design and technology solutions.
03

Driving Question
How can we create a successful co ee shop business using innovative technology, design, and nancial planning to ensure pro tability and customer satisfaction?
Objectives/Goals
By the end of this project, you will:
1. Use the product development template to de ne and document the purpose of a feasibility study for starting a business
2. Utilize Fusion 360 to design essential co ee machine components, such as heat distribution systems and water ow mechanisms.
3. Understand circuit design principles for automating water pumps and push-button systems in co ee machines. 4. Implement digital inputs/outputs and control logic for automating the water pumps using Arduino. 5. Design functional circuits using Arduino to control water pumps, ensuring they start/stop with appropriate inputs. 6. Understand the di erence between UI (User Interface) and UX (User Experience) design.
7. Explain how UI/UX principles in uence the usability and engagement of a mobile app in a co ee shop setting.
8. Use HTML to create the structure of a fully-functional co ee shop website, including sections like the homepage, menu, about page, and contact forms.
Your Challenge
By the end of this project, you’ll have:
Developed a complete business plan and feasibility study for a new co ee shop, analyzing market opportunities and nancial requirements.
Designed key components of a co ee machine using Fusion 360 and created an automated water pump system using Arduino.
Programmed Arduino circuits to control the co ee machine’s water ow with push-button functionality.
Created a mobile app or website to manage customer interactions and orders, applying UI/UX design principles for a smooth user experience. Presented your co ee shop plan and prototype to a panel, showcasing how your business can successfully operate with a combination of entrepreneurial strategy and technology.
Are you ready to build a co ee shop model that could become the next big thing in the food and beverage industry? Let’s get started!

A Printed Circuit Board (PCB) is a at board used to connect and hold electronic components. It is made of a solid material, usually berglass, with thin copper layers that form pathways for electricity. These pathways replace wires and help connect components like resistors, capacitors, and chips. PCBs are used in almost all electronic devices, such as computers, phones, and TVs, because they make circuits compact, reliable, and easy to produce.

In this PCB project, we are adding ICs:
Integrated Circuit (IC) is a small electronic component made of multiple tiny electronic parts like transistors, resistors, and diodes, all combined into a single chip.
It performs speci c tasks or operations in an electronic circuit, such as logic operations, signal processing, or memory storage.
Logic Gates:
1. AND Gate
Combines two or more inputs. The output is ON (1) only when all inputs are ON (1). Example: A light turns on only if two switches are pressed.
2. NOT Gate
Has a single input. The output is the opposite of the input. Example: If the input is ON (1), the output is OFF (0).
3. NOR Gate
Combines two or more inputs. The output is ON (1) only when all inputs are OFF (0). Example: A warning light stays o unless both conditions (like temperature and pressure) are safe.
